question: A sample of water is found to contain 5.85% (w/w) of AB (molecular mass 58.5) and 9.50% (w/w) $XY_2$ (molecular mass 95). Assuming 80% ionisation of AB and 60% ionisation of $XY_2$, the freezing point of water sample is:
[Given: $K_f$ for water 1.86 K kg mol$^{-1}$, Freezing point of pure water is 273 K]
explanation: 1. Molality calculation is needed. Moles AB = 5.85/58.5 = 0.1. Moles XY2 = 9.5/95 = 0.1. Mass solvent = 100 - (5.85+9.5) = 84.65g.
